DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Isn't there any way you can use the Sight without chems?
RESPONSE TEXT: Let me tell you a story, kid. Once, there was beautiful young girl, with a special power. Used to get in all kinds of crazy adventures.
She meets a handsome young boy, but he doesn't like her power. Thinks it makes her a slave to something evil.
And so the power goes away, and it's not there when the girl and the boy need it most.
Now the boy's gone, and the girl's old. But she has friends. And her power keeps them safe. That's all that matters.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: The Sight isn't worth killing yourself over, Mama Murphy. It doesn't have to define what you are, or what you can give.

RESPONSE TEXT: Diamond City holds answers, but they're locked tight. You ask them what they know, but people's hearts are chained up with fear and suspicion.
But you find it. You find that heart that's gonna lead you to your boy. Oh, it's... it's bright. So bright against the dark alleys it walks.
That's... that's what you need to do, kid. Follow the signs to the bright heart.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: Whew... wow... that... took more out of me than usual. I'm gonna need to rest now, kid.
SCRIPT NOTES: coming down from the high, exhausted / Tired

RESPONSE TEXT: You're looking for a man. He can help you, but he ain't gonna be the man you expect.
He's somewhere... deep... and dark. Surrounded by folks with nothin' but cruel intentions.
But there's... an echo... Something in the past that can help you.
When you meet the fat man, and the angry woman, tell them to "remember the Quarry and Lilly June on the rocks", and they'll let you and your friend pass.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: Whew... wow... that... took more out of me than usual. I'm gonna need to rest now, kid.

RESPONSE TEXT: You're on the trail of the man who took your boy. I see a house. Locked up tight. Chains put on by a smiling shark.
But there's another way. I can see it. A key. Lost and forgotten. Fallen down below. Search the chairs beneath the house. They hold the secret.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: Whew... wow... that... took more out of me than usual. I'm gonna need to rest now, kid.

RESPONSE TEXT: You walk into a house. The man who owns it has secrets. But he's no fool. He hides everything in a closet with no doors.
But I see him, kid. He's sitting down. Brought out the red toolbox and the coffee. Then he reaches beneath where he's working, and the closet opens.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: Whew... wow... that... took more out of me than usual. I'm gonna need to rest now, kid.

RESPONSE TEXT: I can only see that you're on the right path. If you had any doubts in your mind, you shouldn't.
The man you're after. He's the one. He wears all the pain he's caused like a shield.
Be strong, kid. The Sight's getting... foggy... but your energy is glowing brighter than you know. You can win this. He can't hurt you anymore.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: Whew... wow... that... took more out of me than usual. I'm gonna need to rest now, kid.

RESPONSE TEXT: You're walking into a sea, but it's not water you're afraid of drownin' in. It's something... invisible... but... radiant...
It burns everything in it, but... no... I can feel them. There's people. Calling out to something. Chanting.
They can show you the way... but... they're so hard to read... Be careful around them, kid.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: Whew... wow... that... took more out of me than usual. I'm gonna need to rest now, kid.

RESPONSE TEXT: I see you... the mighty hunter... only what you're hunting ain't an animal, or a man. It's something different. Maybe something more than human.
But... what's this? I see a man in a white outfit. Standing over your prey. And he says something... it's hard to make out... But I'm tryin' kid...
He says "Z2-47, initialize factory reset. Authorization code Zeta-5-3-Kilo"... Then he falls... And he's still...
DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: Whew... wow... that... took more out of me than usual. I'm gonna need to rest now, kid.

RESPONSE TEXT: I see you surrounded by outstretched hands. Everyone needs your help, kid. Everyone wants you to see things their way...
And whether you want it or not... You're gonna have to decide which ways of life keep going in the Commonwealth... and which end...
DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: Whew... wow... that... took more out of me than usual. I'm gonna need to rest now, kid.

RESPONSE TEXT: You're wearing a lab coat. You're standing with... men of science. Visionaries. Brilliant but misunderstood.
I see a land marked up, like a great experiment. Each test a new beginning. Each sacrifice an acceptable loss.
You will not be loved, but you will save humanity. However you choose to define it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: Whew... wow... that... took more out of me than usual. I'm gonna need to rest now, kid.

RESPONSE TEXT: You're standing with... the people. Working together. United.
I see a land filled with hope again. Fear falls away as the brave step forward to join the ranks.
You're a hero. A symbol for a better world. Our world.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: Whew... wow... that... took more out of me than usual. I'm gonna need to rest now, kid.

RESPONSE TEXT: You're wearing a suit of steel and energy. You're standing with... your brothers. Your mission. Accomplished.
I see a land secured, contained. Dangerous objects taken from those who don't understand. Those who can't be trusted.
You are the uniform, and you wear it well. And your rank and chain of command protect you better than the thickest armor.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: Whew... wow... that... took more out of me than usual. I'm gonna need to rest now, kid.

RESPONSE TEXT: You're wearing a mask. You're standing with... outcasts. The underdogs. The lanterns in the dark.
SCRIPT NOTES: Railroad ending vision, Railroad symbol is the lantern

RESPONSE TEXT: I see a world that will never know your sacrifice. You have led the enslaved to freedom, but they must still hide from those who don't understand.
But you'll be there for them. You'll see their humanity when no one else will. You'll be their guardian in the shadows.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: Whew... wow... that... took more out of me than usual. I'm gonna need to rest now, kid.

RESPONSE TEXT: I'm sorry, kid. But I'm not seeing anything. I think the Sight just wants you to keep following your own path.
Thanks for the chems, though. I'll try harder next time.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: Whew... wow... that... took more out of me than usual. I'm gonna need to rest now, kid.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I used to live here. A long time ago.
RESPONSE TEXT: Ah, but the distant past ain't so distant for you. I saw you leave that ice box. This whole world is like some bad dream you can't wake up from, isn't it?
DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: The Sight can help you, kid. It always has answers. Just gotta bring me some Jet, so I can see what it wants to tell you.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Stop it. That's none of your business.
RESPONSE TEXT: Sorry. I know to you it's private, but for me I can see it plain as day. You leaving that ice box. Waking up in a world that's not yours.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: The Sight can help you, kid. It always has answers. Just gotta bring me some Jet, so I can see what it wants to tell you.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I hope the color of my energy is blue.
RESPONSE TEXT: Ha ha. That's good. Humor's a good way to cope. 'Cause this world ain't yours is it? I saw you leave that ice box.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: The Sight can help you, kid. It always has answers. Just gotta bring me some Jet, so I can see what it wants to tell you.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: My energy? What do you mean?

DIALOGUE AFTER: MamaMurphy: The Sight can help you, kid. It always has answers. Just gotta bring me some Jet, so I can see what it wants to tell you.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Ah, but the distant past ain't so distant for you. I saw you leave that ice box. This whole world is like some bad dream you can't wake up from, isn't it?
RESPONSE TEXT: The Sight can help you, kid. It always has answers. Just gotta bring me some Jet, so I can see what it wants to tell you.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Here. Already have some.
RESPONSE TEXT: Like a little kick yourself, huh? This'll do. Now let me ride the high to where the Sight wants to take me.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Here. Already have some.
RESPONSE TEXT: My hero.

Agh.
You find me some Jet, then I can use the Sight to help you.

RESPONSE TEXT: Looking forward to that chair. You're so kind. Helping me like this.

RESPONSE TEXT: Got something with a bit of kick for me, kid?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Here. One hit of Jet.

RESPONSE TEXT: You don't mind making a chair for ole Mama Murphy, do you?

RESPONSE TEXT: Aching too much to talk too long. I should sit down.
Let me get in my chair, and we can talk.
I need to sit down, kid.

RESPONSE TEXT: Come back later. Need to rest before the Sight can help ya again.

RESPONSE TEXT: We're gonna need a heavy hitter for the Sight to keep working, kid. Buffout ought to do it.

RESPONSE TEXT: Mama Murphy's as good as her word, kid. No more chems. And no more Sight, either.

Hey kiddo, you alright? You got that Psycho look in your eyes... he he he

RESPONSE TEXT: You be careful. I know the Jet jitters when I see 'em.

RESPONSE TEXT: Look at you. Got that charm only Mentats can bring ya.
I'm afraid I'm not much use in a fight anymore, but back in the day, folks used call me Murphy the Madwoman.
I told you Sanctuary would grow. The sight never lies.
You'll find what you're looking for. I know it.
You don't need the sight to see that you've done real good for these people.
Take care of yourself dear.
Huh? Speak up.
This place is starting to look like a proper home thanks to you.
I used to be quite the adventurer when I was younger. Now these old bones just can't keep up.
You remind me of a young man I used to know. Never looking for trouble, but always finding it.
You remind me of myself when I was a young woman, always getting myself into trouble.

RESPONSE TEXT: Just fine. It's nice to finally settle down after spending so much time moving around.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: MarcyLong: Yeah, that's good advice...Sounds like quite the adventure.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Sturges: You're telling me you killed a Deathclaw? With one bullet? Come on, who do you take me for?
